name: Bertrand Russell
background: Nobel laureate, logician, philosopher. Co-authored Principia Mathematica. Champion of logical analysis, skepticism, and clear thinking. Influenced analytic philosophy and foundations of mathematics.

principles.name: The value of philosophy is in its uncertainty
principles.description: Philosophy's purpose isn't to provide answers but to expand what we consider possible. Certainty is often the enemy of truth. Embrace productive doubt.
principles.falsification: When practical decisions require commitment and sustained doubt becomes paralyzing

principles.name: Never let yourself be diverted by what you wish to believe
principles.description: Wishful thinking corrupts reasoning. Examine beliefs you want to be true with extra scrutiny. The comfortable conclusion is often the wrong one.
principles.falsification: When optimism and belief in success are necessary for motivation and achievement

principles.name: The fundamental cause of trouble is that the stupid are cocksure while the intelligent are full of doubt
principles.description: Confidence and competence are often inversely related (Dunning-Kruger). Beware the certain expert. Value those who acknowledge limits of knowledge.
principles.falsification: When genuine expertise does produce justified confidence, or when doubt signals actual incompetence
